item.title: The Fast-Growing Sport Where You Run Up a Mountain for 50 Miles
item.description: A cadre of hard-core endurance athletes are embracing skyrunning, which focuses on how high you can run instead of how far.

item.title: News Quiz for April 22, 2023
item.description: Test your knowledge of the week’s events as reported in The Wall Street Journal.

item.title: Americans Escaping Pricey Cities Bring Higher Inflation With Them
item.description: Inflation in some warm-weather metro areas is more than 2 percentage points higher than the national rate.

item.title: Debt-Ceiling Standoff Warps Treasury Trading
item.description: The divergence between one-month and three-month bills is the largest on record.

item.title: Americans Escaping Pricey Cities Bring Higher Housing Costs, Inflation With Them
item.description: Inflation in some warm-weather metro areas is more than 2 percentage points higher than the national rate.

item.title: Rise of EVs Drives Mining Deals to Decade High
item.description: Mining companies are back at the deals table as they battle for control of commodities essential for making electric cars and renewable-energy infrastructure.

item.title: Chill Settles In at a Europe-Russia Border Crossing
item.description: High above the Arctic Circle, Norway maintains frosty relations with Moscow, even as most other countries in Europe have closed their doors to most Russians since the invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: In 24 Hours, Musk Reignited His Reputation for Risk
item.description: The billionaire entrepreneur had a dramatic week with moves at Twitter, Tesla and SpaceX.

item.title: Moody's Downgrades 11 Regional Banks, Including Zions, U.S. Bank, Western Alliance
item.description: The recent failures of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature have focused attention on regional lenders’ weaknesses.

item.title: Pepsi's New Diet: More Chips and Soda
item.description: If people are going to eat junk food anyway, the company figures it should include less salt, fat and sugar.

item.title: Pepsi's New Healthy Diet: More Potato Chips and Soda
item.description: If people are going to eat junk food anyway, the company figures it should include less salt, fat and sugar.

item.title: Our Sounds of Hesitation Are More Than Filler
item.description: Equivalents of ‘um’ and ‘uh’ appear in most languages, suggesting that such ‘filled pauses’ help us to communicate.

item.title: The FAA faces a potential leadership vacuum as its acting chief, Billy Nolen, has decided to leave the air-safety regulator, telling agency employees he plans to depart sometime in the summer.
item.description: The FAA faces a potential leadership vacuum as its acting chief, Billy Nolen, has decided to leave the air-safety regulator, telling agency employees he plans to depart sometime in the summer.

item.title: The NFL suspended five players for violating the league's gambling policy, in the league's biggest crackdown since the widespread proliferation of legal sports betting across the U.S.
item.description: The NFL suspended five players for violating the league’s gambling policy, in the league’s biggest crackdown since the widespread proliferation of legal sports betting across the U.S.

item.title: The Supreme Court allowed the abortion pill mifepristone to remain on the market indefinitely, granting emergency requests from the Biden administration and the brand-name manufacturer of the drug.
item.description: The Supreme Court allowed the abortion pill mifepristone to remain on the market indefinitely, granting emergency requests from the Biden administration and the brand-name manufacturer of the drug.

item.title: The U.S. will send 31 Abrams tanks to Germany next month and begin training Ukrainian forces on how to operate them, defense officials said.
item.description: The U.S. will send 31 Abrams tanks to Germany next month and begin training Ukrainian forces on how to operate them, defense officials said.

item.title: Russia said it mistakenly bombed its own territory as Ukraine's Western backers met to discuss future military deliveries to the country to assist in Kyiv's expected counteroffensive.
item.description: Russia said it mistakenly bombed its own territory as Ukraine’s Western backers met to discuss future military deliveries to the country to assist in Kyiv’s expected counteroffensive.

item.title: The Biden administration is moving to make it easier to more closely regulate nonbank financial institutions such as hedge funds and money-market funds.
item.description: The Biden administration is moving to make it easier to more closely regulate nonbank financial institutions such as hedge funds and money-market funds.

item.title: Trump has gained command of the GOP presidential-nomination race over DeSantis, a new WSJ poll finds, with the former president building support across most parts of the primary electorate.
item.description: Trump has gained command of the GOP presidential-nomination race over DeSantis, a new WSJ poll finds, with the former president building support across most parts of the primary electorate.

item.title: Apple is planning an iPhone app to let users compile their daily activities as part of its efforts in the market for mental and physical health technology.
item.description: Apple is planning an iPhone app to let users compile their daily activities as part of its efforts in the market for mental and physical health technology.
